column5: guys i finally have a full day off after cant even remeber when on the 21st - want to get out and do some fishing - i know its still cold but o well can any one suggest a good place where i may get some good off shore action ( i got no boat) i would prefer something within an hours radious of the GTA - if any one knows of any good creeeks or can suggest a good lake area - there is 3 of us all bigenners who just want to hook something  much appreciated
Well, Simco would be a good choice, Cooks Bay, even if you don't have an auger there will be lots of holes drilled and you should be able to get some good perch and pike action.
yea buts thats for ice fishing right - i just want to do some shore fishing through the line in and SIT!! hopefully have some bites

Well, you can sit while ice fishing but I don't think you are going to find too many places to fish from shore just yet unless you want to go for some rainbows. You could check out Bronte Creek, or some of the other places along the lake shore.

Mind you many of the creeks are closed North of Hwy 2, especially in around here... Don't know when the piers will, and surroundings will start getting busy. Like Cliff said, most of everything will be frozen... Cooks is a great option to sit throw your bait in and wait, by the way
What about ten minutes south of you in Caledonia?
